and then you turn this whole thing into a satisfiability problem and the satisfiability engine looks for some set
of inputs that satisfy the constraints that you've given that would cause the property to be violated and if there
exists such a set of inputs it will find it furthermore the way you do this typically is you'll unroll it one level
at a time and do the check at each level so you're guaranteed to find the shortest the shortest distance from the
initial state that actually violates the property so that's one of the the key properties of bounded model checking as
